speaker: User
message: Hi, this is PERSON_FIRSTNAME_2. How may I help you?

speaker: User
message: Hi, may I ask regarding question regarding the APA 7th edition citation?

speaker: User
message: For example, if I need to cite a source of link https://my.clevelandclinic.org/health/drugs/11195-fluoride

speaker: User
message: do i cite it as Fluoride. (2018, July 10). Cleveland Clinic. Retrieved January 29, 2023, from https://my.clevelandclinic.org/health/drugs/11195-fluoride

speaker: User
message: given that the article title is the same as the organisation name?

speaker: User
message: Okay thank you, would the site title be the "Drugs, Devices & Supplements"?

speaker: User
message: or would it still be Cleveland Clinic?

speaker: User
message: My apologies, I meant would the site name be "Drugs, Devices & Supplements", according to the format: Author, A. A. (YYYY, Month dd). Title. Site Name. URL.

speaker: User
message: Thank you, that's all the questions I have.

speaker: Help desk
message: Sure, how may I help you?

speaker: Help desk
message: Hi PERSON_LASTNAME_1, please use the general website format in our APA citation guide

speaker: Help desk
message: The author would be Cleveland Clinic. You need not repeat the site name as shown in the example given in the site.

speaker: Help desk
message: Note that the word Retrieve .... is no longer required in APA 7th edition. Hence, do follow the format as given in our guide.

speaker: Help desk
message: Hi PERSON_LASTNAME_1, the title is what you see on the article heading, hence, it is Fluoride.

speaker: Help desk
message: The site name is typically the host of the website. Hence, it is Cleveland Clinic. However, since it is also the author. You need not repeat the site name.

speaker: Help desk
message: no problem. is there anything else I can help you with?

speaker: Help desk
message: ok. have a good day PERSON_LASTNAME_1.
